data.title: PhysicsBody raypicking does not adhere to MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win7 x64 - [2.1alpha / 00bfdc834bc028e7c15e939662a72353250d00f3]

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you set up any physicsbody to be raypickable, the picking will work correctly if the mouse_mode is set to `visible`. If you set the mouse_mode to `mouse_mode_captured`, it'll send the raypick as if the mouse _wasn't_ captured.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create any physicsbody, and make sure "raypick" is enabled
2. Create a script, and connect the physicbody's `input` signal so you know when you're picking it
3. Create a camera and point it so that the rigidbody is on the screen
4. Toggle between captured/visible verifying that the picking is wrong

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[RayPickTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/308269/RayPickTest.zip)

[Example Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=idN3OfNjwlY)

data.title: VideoPlayer throws error when it loads video without sound
data.body:
here's example godot code

```
var re = ResourceLoader.load("res://video.ogv")
get_node("VideoPlayer").set_stream(re)
get_node("VideoPlayer").play()
```

if video.ogv do not contains 'sound', VideoPlayer throws error.
else if it contains any little sound, works well.

![image](http://i.imgur.com/wvxTDwT.png)

data.title: Revert "Fix min size bug of Label"
data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#5052

data.title: look_at() Not Working With KinematicBody Initially
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux and Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Did an earlier test of look_at() with a camera and it works fine. Now I'm trying to get a KinematicBody to look at another KinematicBody and it's returning an error: "Condition det == 0 true" in "core/math/matrix3.cpp." 

Issue seems to have resolved now, though. But might happen again so I'm posting this report.

Went into the IRC to get help and the users were baffled.

How I resolved it was to create a testcube and test it with that. It worked to my amazement. Then I wired it back up to look at the other KinematicBody and moved the body (before it was right above the looking at body) and it seemed to work. Did more tests including moving it back above the looking at body and they all worked, no error. 

Edit: Even though it works now, I notice that when the object moves past and above the looking at object it jitters as it passes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Wire up a KinematicBody to look at something directly above it perhaps using look_at().

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[move_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/308100/move_test.zip)

It is expected that saving a resource like an fnt or tilemap res file, will be immediately visible in the resource load dialog (the file manager window), but the resources arent visible (not event hitting the refresh button), you have to restart the editor in order to see the resources

data.title: GridMap with a NavigationMeshInstance will crash the game.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1 alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Having a GridMap with a NavigationMeshInstance will crash the game when run. There is no error in the debugger.

Create a mesh library, with one mesh having a NavigationMeshInstance. Then create a simple GridMap using that mesh library.

data.title: Add rulers and guide liens to the 2D editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**: Windows, Linux, MacOS

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Hello,

I think a few things will improve the 2D Editor if would be added:
1) Rulers
- Horizontal and Vertical (something similar with the image from this link: http://s32.postimg.org/ax9fga511/rulers.png)
- Configurable (customize the 10 and 50 lines: different colors, different numbers)

2) Guide lines
    - Drag them from the Rules as in GIMP
    - Possibility to hide/show them
    - Rotate them by a specific angle
    - More "hard core" customization: Possibility to edit them as Bezier curves
    - Change colors
    - Combine them in groups and change colors by a group

**Steps to reproduce:** N/A

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome): N/A

data.title: Config should be able to create .tscn like config files
data.body:
Would be nice if .tscn like ini could be generated and used for the game.

```
[tscn name="name" type="type1" parent="parentname"]
key = 20
```

`set_tscn("name", "type1", "parentname")`
`set_tscn_value("name", "type1", "key", 20)`

`get_tscn_types()` = return a list of all types
`get_tscn("type1")` = return a list of all tscn objects of that type
`get_tscn_keys("name", "type1")`= returns a list of all keys for that name and type
`get_tscn_values("name,"type1")` = returns a list of all valeus for that name and type

`set_tscn("name","type1", "newname", "newtype", "newparent")`

data.title: Preserve position and size of godot's editor window betwin sessions.
data.body:
**Godot version**: 2.0.3 stable ( _and 2.1 alpha - current build as of 2016-06-09_ )
**Operating system**: windows 7

**The reason of the proposal**:
Every person have its own way of working, tools he use and how they are arranged all together on screen. Unfortunately godot editor is perhaps the only one, which do not remember its position and size betwin sessions, so it is necessary to move and resize it, to desired location and size, every time its started.

If someone is frequently jumping betwin projects - **it turns into unnecessary additional burden, where one instead of concentrate on main problem - plays endlesly with ordering windows on screen every fiew minutes or even several seconds**. Believe me - after 100 times it might begin to be a hassle and start destroying all the fun.
All just because, while godot do all the complex stuff, it forgets about the most basic one, like - to remember its own position and size.

**Enhancement proposal**: 
Godot **Editor should save its window position and size when window is closed (destroyed)**,
and **restore its position and size when window is opened (created)**,
so it always appear at expected and usual for the user placement,
saving him from playing around with windows ordering instead of working on main project.
**Its very small adjustment but same time a huge improvement, time and distraction saving feature**.

As for me, it could be enought if Editor just save and restore its window position and size, and thats it.
There is no need for any additional settings for it.

_But perhaps there might be someone who would like to have it saved per project.
(where setting could be saved into project's engine.cfg file instead of editor's config file)
But... imho, saving it per project might preserve unnecessary hasle since there might be many different placements betwin projects and again, when jumping betwin projects it might enforce one to move and scale editor's window and the end.
Therefore IF saving it per project could be implemented too, it could be reasonable to add [checkbox] in editor settings, like [save editors window placement per project] to give user option to chose if he want editor to just remember its placement globaly for all projects, or save it along with project so every project might have its own different window placement._

data.title: Double events (Discussion)
data.body:
Then came the first day:
I make a version for Android and it worked cross:

```
func _unhandled_input(e):
    if e.is_echo() || get_state() != S_LIVE || !e.is_pressed():
        return

    if (e.type == InputEvent.MOUSE_BUTTON && e.button_mask & (BUTTON_LEFT | BUTTON_RIGHT)):
        _next_dir()
        game.add_score(1)
```

And I was glad.
Then came the second day:
Then they gathered for IOS and found that it no longer works. Quickly realizing that what he added:

```
func _unhandled_input(e):
    if e.is_echo() || get_state() != S_LIVE || !e.is_pressed():
        return

    if e.type == InputEvent.SCREEN_TOUCH || (e.type == InputEvent.MOUSE_BUTTON && e.button_mask & (BUTTON_LEFT | BUTTON_RIGHT)):
        _next_dir()
        game.add_score(1)
```

And on IOS earned. And the sun was shining brightly and the sky was cloudless
Then came the third day:
He returned to the version on the android. He discovered that no longer work. I check all. All all right but still does not work. I began to look and found that the source android getting press on the screen at first sends the press as an event from the mouse and then once already as an event of touch. Because of this action in the script worked twice in a row (the second takes away the first), and I do not what happened.
Attention to the question: why it was done? No need to be combined into one 2 very different events. Well, or at least while on other platforms to make the same behavior.

data.title: Determining platform from a script (improvement 2.0.x)
data.body:
It took a split of the script depending on whether it is running on any platform. As a result, it is found only "OS.get_name ()". Who also returns a string. Sometimes it is useful. But in most cases it would be necessary to function "OS.get_platform ()" that returns the number. And in the engine would be constant platforms. For example:

```
const PLATFORM_UNKNOWN = 0
const PLATFORM_ANDROID = 1
const PLATFORM_IOS = 2
const PLATFORM_OSX = 4
```

That they were flags. In this case, you can conveniently share the script depending on the target platform. For example:

```
if OS.get_platform () & (OS.PLATFORM_ANDROID | OS.PLATFORM_IOS):
```

Of course this functionality can be made to function through the statics but I would like that it was implemented in the engine.

data.title: Filling in documentation
data.body:
Documentation for BoneAttachment, KinematicBody, ParallaxBackground,
ParallaxLayer, and TestCube

data.title: Deleting a Script via OS file manager or "FileSystem" panel leaves references in code even if not visibly referenced in project
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows-2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Whenever a script is deleted from a project (not attached to a node or referenced in another script) via your OS's file manager or the delete function in the "FileSystem" panel, there are still references in the code (as whenever the project is opened up, error messages referencing the absence of the files appear) even if it was never visibly referenced in the project itself

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new project
Create a script and save it to the project folder
Delete script via either method
Close and reopen project
Observe the command line for errors

data.title: Search letter-wise instead of word-wise
data.body:
This is a usability improvement.

It is better to show search results that contain the typed "letters" instead of correctly spelled words. The working is similar to sublime text autocomplete where you don't have to type a method/property in the correct word.

For eg: 
In Godot Create Node Popup window, we can start typing "kin" to get Nodes that starts with letters "kin". It includes both KinematicBody and KinematicBody2D including their parents.
But I want to select the KinematicBody2D in the list. According to my proposal, if we type "kin2" the resulting nodes will be that contains the letters "k","i","n" and "2". So I can quickly select the node without moving my hand from keyboard to mouse.

data.title: Ability to perform live editing from a PC to another PC
data.body: It would be very welcome to have support for live editing (and one-click deploy, remote filesystem, ) when two PCs are on the same Ethernet or Wi-Fi network. This way, you could develop the game on one PC, and test it on another PC.

data.title: Caret blink no longer updates when hidden, issue 5100
data.body:
Caret blink no longer updates when hidden. 

closes #5100
